contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|drop}} '''Drop''' may refer to: * [[Drop (liquid)]] or droplet, a small volume of liquid ** [[Eye drop]]s, saline (sometimes mydriatic) drops used as medication for the eyes * [[Drop (unit)]], a unit of measure of volume * [[Falling (physics)]], or allowing an object to fall {{tocright}} == Computers and technology == * [[The_Spamhaus_Project#Don.27t_Route_Or_Peer_List|'''D'''on't '''R'''oute '''O'''r '''P'''eer]] List, a list of spam sources * [[Drop (SQL)]], a command in SQL queries to remove an existing database, table, index, or view * [[Drop (telecommunication)]], several meanings == Confectionery == * Cough drop, or [[throat lozenge]], a medicated confectionery * Drop, the Dutch word for sweet or [[salty liquorice]] * [[Lemon drop]], a sugary, lemon-flavored confectionery * [[London drops]], a Swedish/Finnish sugar-coated licorice == Music == * ''D.R.O.P.'', an album and a song by [[Zelda (band)|ZELDA]] * Drop, a slang term, used as a verb, to refer to an album or single's [[release (music)|release]] * "Drop", a song by [[Blue October]] * [[Drop (Bride album)|''Drop'' (Bride album)]], 1995 * [[Drop (Gavin Harrison & 05Ric album)|''Drop'' (Gavin Harrison & 05Ric album)]], 2007 * [[Drop (Timbaland & Magoo song)|"Drop" (Timbaland & Magoo song)]], 2001 * [[Drop (music)]], a section in music where the music will crescendo to a climax, pause briefly, then resume * [[Drop (Rich Boy song)|"Drop" (Rich Boy song)]], 2009 * DROPS, a J-Pop voice actor group consisting of [[Mariko Kouda]], Tomoko Kaneda, Akemi Kanda, Ai Nonaka, and RyÅko Shiraish * [[Drop (The Pharcyde song)|"Drop" (The Pharcyde song)]], 1995 * [[Drop (The Shamen album)|''Drop'' (The Shamen album)]], 1987 * [[Drop (Ying Yang Twins song)|"Drop" (Ying Yang Twins song)]] * [[Needle drop (DJing)]], a hip hop DJ term == Sports == * Bat drop, a number (the weight in ounces minus the length in inches) used in some leagues to regulate [[baseball bat]]s * [[Drop (boxing)]], a type of punch used in boxing * Drop noseband, a type of [[noseband]] used first on horses at the Spanish Riding School * [[Drop off]], a mountain biking term == Other uses == * [[Dead drop]], a term used in espionage to exchange messages covertly between spies * [[Drop (b-boy move)]], a breakdance move * [[Drop, Masovian Voivodeship]], district in east-central Poland * [[Drops (CSI: Crime Scene Investigation character)]], a character in ''CSI: Crime Scene Investigation'' * DROPS, or [[Demountable Rack Offload and Pickup System]], logistic vehicles used by the British Army * [[Hershey's Drops]], a chocolate bar * [[Pigeon drop]], a confidence trick modeled on the dead drop * [[Prince Rupert's Drop]], curiosity made out of molten glass * [[Drop (policy debate)]] == See also == * [[Dropout (disambiguation)]] * [[The Drop (disambiguation)]] * [[Drip (disambiguation)]] {{disambiguation}}
